tier.item: (6) Le docteur entra chez lui et vit sa femme debout.
FRE the doctor entered(PAST) at his/her's and saw(PAST) his wife up
Il lui sourit. Un moment après elle pleurait.
he her smiled(PAST) a moment after she was crying(IMPERF)
`The doctor entered and saw that his wife was up/awake. He smiled at her. A moment
later, she was crying.' (Kamp & Rohrer 1983: 258)

tier.item: (8) Chéen k'uch-uk-o'n-e',
YUK only arrive-SUBJ-B.1.PL-TOP
táan u ts'íib-t-ik hun-p'éel kàarta wal-e'.
PROG A.3 write-APP-INC(B.3.SG) one-CL.IN letter probably-D3
[Said in reply to "What your brother DO (when) we arrive, do you think (= what
activities will he be engaged in)?"] `(When) we arrive, he will be writing a letter, I
guess.' (Tama 17)

tier.item: (9) Le máak-o', túun kach-ik le che'
YUK DEF person-D2 PROG:A.3 break-INC(B.3.SG) DEF tree
káa h k'uch-en-o'. U k'áat y-a'l-e':
káa PRV arrive-B.1.SG-D2 A.3 wish(B.3.SG) A.3-say(B.3.SG)-TOP
ts'-u chúun-ul u kach-ik,
TERM-A.3 start\ACAUS-INC A.3 break-INC(B.3.SG)
pero ma' u láah kach-i'.
but NEG A.3 all break(B.3.SG)-D4
`The man, he was breaking the tree (when) I arrived. This means he had begun to break
it, but he had not yet broken it entirely.'

tier.item: (11) Leti'-e' h xòok-nah ti' las dòos tak astàa las sèeys,
it-TOP PRV read\ATP-CMP(B.3.SG) LOC two.o'clock even until six.o'clock
t-u xok-ah le pèeriyodiko te las sèeys ti'
PRV-A.3 read-INC(B.3.SG)DEF newspaper LOC:DEF six.o'clock LOC
tak las syèete, káa h hàan-ih, ti' las syèete ti' tak
even seven.o'clock káa PRV eat-B.3.SGLOC seven.o'clock LOC even
las òocho-i', káa túun h bin túun leti' t-u kàama.
eight.o'clock-D4 káa CON PRV go(B.3.SG) CON it LOC-A.3 bed
`As for him, he studied from two to six, he read the paper from six to seven, then he had
dinner, between seven and eight, and then he went to bed.' (Proga 72)

it-TOP PRV read\ATP-CMP(B.3.SG) LOC two.o'clock even until six.o'clock PRV-A.3 read-INC(B.3.SG)DEF newspaper LOC:DEF six.o'clock LOC even seven.o'clock káa PRV eat-B.3.SGLOC seven.o'clock LOC even eight.o'clock-D4 káa CON PRV go(B.3.SG) CON it LOC-A.3 bed
As for him, he studied from two to six, he read the paper from six to seven, then he had dinner, between seven and eight, and then he went to bed.
(Proga 72)

tier.item: b. Acabo de hablar con Luis. Me ha dicho
I just talked with Luis me(OBL) he has(PRS) said(PTC)
que mañana no podrá venir a la reunión.
that tomorrow not he will be able(FUT) come(INF) to the meeting
`I just talked to Luis. He told me he won't be able to come to the meeting tomorrow.'
